title: Man dies after being ‘doused in accelerant’ and set on fire outside home
text:
Robert Beattie was rushed to hospital after being set on fire on his doorstep (Picture: PA/Google Maps)

A murder probe has been launched after a man was set on fire outside his home in Lancashire.

Robert Beattie, 48, was rushed to hospital following the incident in Skelmersdale at about 1am on September 26.

But the victim died on Thursday night, said Lancashire Police, who have since opened a murder investigation.

He suffered serious burns in the attack after it is believed he was doused in a type of accelerant when he answered his front door.

Four men from Liverpool and one man from Skelmersdale were previously arrested in connection with the investigation but were later bailed.

Detective Chief Inspector Pauline Stables said: ‘This is tragic news and our thoughts remain with Mr Beattie’s family and friends at this incredibly sad time.

Robert died on Thursday (Picture: PA)

He was attacked outside his home in Waverley (Picture: Google Maps)

‘While we have made a number of arrests, our inquiries are very much ongoing and we have a number of detectives working on this investigation.

‘If you have any information at all that could help and haven’t contacted us already please get in touch with us as soon as possible.’

Anyone with information should contact police on 101 quoting log 0068 of September 26, or alternatively independent charity Crimestoppers can be contacted anonymously on 0800 555 111 or online at crimestoppers-uk.org.

description: Robert Beattie, of Skelmersdale, Lancashire, died after being set on fire outside his home.
